Description: Roundel fragment from the lower part of the clavus; tapestry is applied and sewn on plain weave linen; the roundel has three concentric circles; the central part is decorated with a standing human figure, the figure is naked?, very stylized, with red hair, a red ornament on the chest, orientated to the left with right hand held up, above or held by the hand is a bird (duck?), on a green background and with a stylized vegetal motif on either side of the figure; the central medallion is surrounded by a freize of stylized vegetal and floral motifs (red and pink heart-shaped flowers on yellow background); final part of the tapestry is a freize of multi-coloured geometric motifs on a dark blue background; plain weave: warp-undyed linen (S/11), weft-undyed linen (S/16); all edges cut or ragged, a run-and-fell seam c.2 cm, sewing threads in undyed linen threads (S spun Z ply), oversewing and running stitches; tapestry on grouped threads: warp-undyed linen (S spun Z ply/9), weft-undyed linen (S), pink, red, yellow, blue and dark blue (S/green is 76); edges mostly hemmed and sewn with oversewing in linen (S spun Z ply), at the top part edge is ragged; extra threads in pink and yellow wool (very bright and maybe added at a later date)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
